trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_1<tab>Chasing an elite mark, I presume. Adventurers hither, adventurers thither. Soon we shall have to write <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> into the Raimdelle Codex.
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_A1_000_2<tab>Tell me about the rank B elite mark. (Phecda)
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_A1_000_3<tab>Tell me about the rank A elite mark. (Girtab)
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_A1_000_4<tab>Tell me about the rank S elite mark. (Thousand-cast Theda)
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_10<tab>I am the elite mark hunter. I contemplate the codex, hunt the hideous, and preserve the peace.
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_11<tab>And of course, I bag the bounty of Allied Seals when I do slay one of those mischief-makers.
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_12<tab>If you have something to ask, don't tarry. The elite mark waits for no one.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_13<tab>In fact, sometimes it will seem that a rank S elite mark appears for no one. “S” would be the most feral of the elite marks. They are ranked by danger, you see.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_20<tab>“A bear of unusual size from the distant heights of Abalathia's Spine, Phecda's southward migration has not been a happy one for the Black Shroud.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_21<tab>“Its uncouth appetite has emptied whole areas of the forest of edibles and game, and no hunter has returned with evidence of a cull─or returned at all. Phecda may be distinguished from its more peaceable cousins by the constant slick of blood upon its claws.”
TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_30<tab>“Girtab, the mightiest among mites that ravage the North Shroud.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_31<tab>“Painstaking field observations have revealed that the Girtab prefers its prey fresh, and keeps a living larder of two- and four-legged meals artfully held fast in a web.”

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_40<tab>“Botanists call Thousand-cast Theda as well grown a specimen of ochu as ever has been recorded in the North Shroud, but the foolishness of botanists is a fact well known and oft deplored.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_41<tab>“Most species of this carnivorous family of bindweed use scent to lure their insect prey. Theda, however, is a plant notably lacking in patience and has evolved tentacle-like vines to pluck fish from water, and grows outsized on its rich meals.

TEXT_REGFSTNOTORIOUSMONSTERHINTF4_00197_MOBHUNTERF1F4_000_42<tab>“Along with the fisherfolk of the Shroud, Thousand-cast Theda is the main predator of venomous stingrays. Theda's other favored prey is, coincidentally, the fisherfolk of the Shroud. Hunters suspect a connection, but the foolishness of hunters is a fact well known.”
